commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Use explicit count modifiers
commits.body:
The `{,N}` extension is not supported by most Regexp engines, as it is
an Onigurma-only extension.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Fix indentation of var statements not terminated with a semi-colon
commits.body: Fixes #39

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Update grammar to enable smart <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>↩</kbd> behavior with (‸) and [‸]

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Improved indentation patterns

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Support generator's asterisk
commits.body:
JavaScript generators are already widely used but TM still does not
highlight their syntax. Even worse adding asterisk currently breaks the
function highlighting. Even though it's a draft specification it should be
support ed and possibly (unlikely) tweaked if the specification changes.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Unbind <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃⌥⌘H</kbd> from Copy as Bookmarklet to Clipboard
commits.body:
<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃⌥⌘H</kbd> was previous bound to 'Copy as Bookmarklet to Clipboard' but this binding
conflicted with 'Hide HTML Output'.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Add $ to word boundaries for keyword matches
commits.body:
When matching JavaScript keywords, the start/end were simple word boundaries but
since JavaScript also allows identifiers to use '$' in the name, this would
result in a whole identifier not being matched as a keyword but if a keyword
were within the identifier, it would be matched and scoped.

Fixes #29

commits.author: Adam Strzelecki
commits.summary: Move Copy as Bookmarklet to Ctrl+Opt+Cmd+H
commits.body: This makes Ctrl+Shift+H to trigger reformat on both C & JavaScript.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Update regex to match within ternary if block
commits.body: Fixes #31

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Update regex to match single curly braces
commits.body: Fixes #35

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Add match for shebang line
commits.body:
Adds support to properly scope the shebang line for JavaScript executables and
fixes issue #32.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Add snippet: <kbd class='tabTrigger'>iife⇥</kbd>
commits.body: Creates an immediately-invoked function expression

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Fix style issue with :<kbd class='tabTrigger'>f⇥</kbd> (Object Method) snippet
commits.body: Added a space between the closing function parentheses and the following curly brace

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Add snippets: <kbd class='tabTrigger'>error⇥</kbd> <kbd class='tabTrigger'>log⇥</kbd> and <kbd class='tabTrigger'>warn⇥</kbd>

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Make bundle root menu consistent with other language bundles

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Improve numeric literal match
commits.body: Adds support for exponents and much better matching of various possible numbers. Format taken from ECMAScript 5.1 (EMCA-262), fixes #26.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Prevent false positive regular expression matches
commits.body: This replaces a negative look-ahead mistakenly removed in 7c5414c78ca26a81332e40a284836d9861e17e72, it is needed to prevent false positives with indented block comments. Fixes #27.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Scope shebang line as a comment

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: No longer scope whitespace preceding a regular expression

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Update regex matching to work following commas
commits.body: Fixes #23.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove . and , punctuation matches
commits.body: These were added to use in theme creation but get in the way of better matching the code in other rules. Removed in favor of matching the items as part of larger rules.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: [enhancement] Added a 'throw' snippet.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Add Jeremy Whitlock as the new maintainer

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Allow unicode in identifiers
commits.body: Matches ECMAScript 5.1 spec, with the exception of allowing escape sequences.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Improve word boundary usage
commits.body: Because identifiers can start or end in $ we need to be careful about the usage of \b around them.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Cleaned up the JavaScript grammar
commits.body:
* Full support for the latest JavaScript APIs in your browser
* Removed Java references

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: [cleanup] Removed Dev Guru index and added a .gitignore to ignore *.pyc.

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Add scope to `=` operator for named functions

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Updated 'Documentation for Word' to use Mozilla's Reference
commits.body: * Moved the logic out of Bash and into a Ruby module

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Improve matching of object literal keys and function variables
commits.body:
* Object literal keys are now scoped properly
* Fixed function variable scope/highlighting inconsistency
* Updated Symbol List to contain all function declarations, function expressions
  and object literal keys that are functions

commits.author: Jeremy Whitlock
commits.summary: Correct matching of multi-line function arguments
commits.body: Fixes #17

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Update to 1.4.0 of JS Beautifier

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Add another tab stop for the get-snippet methods.
commits.body: Get-methods are often used with a string parameter, so one more tab stop now allows to get inside of the quotation marks which results in less keys pressed.

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Fix a typo in getElementById method name

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Remove trailing return from prototype snippet

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Remove redundant snippets
commits.body:
"Object Value JS" literally duplicates the 'Object key — key: "value"' snippet.
"Object Method String" provides the code the I highly doubt that many people will use if any.

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Add new snippets: do, else, for in, setInterval, switch, try, while

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Convert get snippet into four snippets all set to <kbd class='tabTrigger'>get⇥</kbd>
commits.body: The previous snippet required further input to select the type, by using four snippets with the same trigger we get a menu to select the desired type.

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Update indentation rules for the switch statement
commits.body: To match the Crockford's code conventions ( http://javascript.crockford.com/code.html ), improving readability.

commits.author: i10k
commits.summary: Update snippets according to the Crockford's code conventions
commits.body:
This removes unneeded semicolons, makes JSHint/JSLint not generate warnings, improves readability. The snippet for the anonymous function is now easier to use as a callback, because of no need to remove the semicolon every time.

More info: http://javascript.crockford.com/code.html

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Revert "Indent line after a one line/braceless statement"
commits.body:
Causing a hang, reverted until this can be fixed. Fixes textmate/textmate#836.

This reverts commit dd95e7c405356492cf18e6f9dc5e9d07f34d3608.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Indent line after a one line/braceless statement
commits.body: Originally from Joseph Pecoraro, fixes #4.
